Google provides various services for Android development using Kotlin, including: 
 

Firebase: A platform offering features like authentication, real-time database, cloud messaging, and more, to help developers build high-quality apps quickly.
 

Android Jetpack: A set of libraries, tools, and guidance to help developers write high-quality apps more easily.
 

Google Play Services: APIs for accessing Google's services, such as Maps, Location, and Analytics, enhancing the functionality of Android apps.
 
 Google Mobile Ads SDK: Allows developers to integrate advertisements into their apps, enabling monetization.
 

Google Analytics for Firebase: Provides insights into app usage and user engagement, helping developers make data-driven decisions.
 

These services help developers create feature-rich and engaging Android apps with Kotlin efficiently.
